Love the game. It's fantastic in so many ways, but dang is it not frustrating as all hell to. I do feel some of the killers are way to strong, like The Huntress with the insta down axes and The Shapes just insta kill ability. Though these are only add-ons, they just feel broken. But really, it is an amazing game worth buying, recommend it by all means if you like gameplay that is scary, intense and super fun with friends. 

They also update the game quite often, adding maps, killers and survivors and much other stuff which keep the game going in the long run.

8/10

This game is legit garbage. It's filled with toxic idiots that will take time out of their day to try to tear you apart for no reason at all. Both survivors and killers have their reasons to hate this game. Let me explain.

From a survivor perspective, the game is just annoying. Teammates you are matched with will troll for no reason and not do anything. You will be getting hooked and they will be camping halfway across the map just crouching in a corner for no reason at all. I'm red rank too and I still get put in matches with people who have absolutely no clue how to play the game or get chased. Killers also don't feel that skillful a lot of the time because they will hit you through windows (even though you're completely on the other side) and through pallets even though they were "stunned". This is probably due to the TERRIBLE hitboxes in the game that are honestly LAUGHABLE. You will get hit so many times when you shouldn't have and it's nothing but annoying. 

Another thing that's annoying about survivor is the perks. Some of them in my opinion are a bit strong (borrowed time, iron will, spine chill), but a lot of them have been nerfed to the GROUND and seem a lot less desirable than they once were, especially decisive strike. You only have 60 seconds now after getting off the hook to use it and most killers will just leave you slugged because they will start chasing the person who rescued you after they down you and it will run out. I maybe use this perk once or twice every 20 matches, it feels nearly useless. A lot of other perks just don't work very well either, a prime example being dead hard. I've died SOOO many times because dead hard decides not to work to some dumb killer who just decided to autoattack me. And yes, I can see that I've used it because it says "exhausted, dead hard" on the right side of my screen to signify that it's been used but I guess it didn't register. In any case, it's very annoying.

From a killer perspective, this game can be even more annoying. First thing is toxic survivors. They abuse through infinite loops, pallets, windows, and other annoying things such as body blocking to stop you from doing what you're supposed to do. They will teabag you and make you feel like you're completely powerless unless you're playing someone with range or who can teleport. This is not true in lower ranks, but in the toxic red ranks it more than certainly is. High ranks isn't even about playing the game, it's about abusing it. 

Another annoying thing is gen rushing. I know it's part of the game, but it's still very frustrating. Sometimes you will hook one person and turn around to see that three out of five gens have been completed. Unless you're running something like NOED, you might feel like you don't have a chance. Again, this is only really in red rank and not in low ranks because survivors have no brains in the lower ranks.

Ranking as killer is also very annoying. Sometimes you will kill all 4 people and STILL get deranked because the survivors got killed too quickly or were trolling. Ranking up as survivor is easy, just play the game and you will rank so long as you're doing what you're supposed to be doing. I've been against survivors who were rank 1 and STILL complete garbage and some were rank 4 but I couldn't even get close to hitting them. Ranking in this game for survivors 75% of the time means jack sh*t, because it's so easy to rank up.

Another thing with killer that's very frustrating is survive with friends (swf) lobbies. These people are the WORST and they screw up the matchmaking system terribly. They all are obviously communicating with each other so they know where to go, what to do and how to jerk you around. When I was a rank 15 killer I was placed in a lobby against two rank 2s, a rank 3, and a rank 19 just because the rank 19 was near my rank. You can imagine how that game went. 

TL;DR this game is complete garbage for both sides, it's toxic and frustrating. Changes need to be made to the core gameplay mechanics if they want the game to function correctly. Here are my suggestions:

-Include a casual game mode for people who don't feel like sweating every two seconds
-Fix hitboxes (for the love of God)
-Change core gameplay (maybe have different game modes rather than just making it so that you have to fix 5 gens every game and then escape)
-Balance killers and survivor perks to make them feel a lot of the bad ones more considerable and the strong ones less essential (you basically need spine chill to play this game against a lot of killers)
-Fix matchmaking to be put with/against more fair odds
-Actually do something about toxic players and not just brush it off. Seriously, the devs don't give a sh*t about toxicity. 

Rather than working on the sh*tty mobile game, maybe you should be fixing the gameplay mechanics first.

its a horror game but the devs ruined any design to make it play as a horror game. and the community made up rules and formed a strong culture of promoting the devs to make the game play as anything but a horror game.

this is done by players treating the killer as something to be fought against instead of avoided. players expect you to use underhanded methods such as looping the killer in circles around objects in the most toxic and annoying way possible in order to either take up as much time as possible just to catch the player and then gang up on the killer in order to free the player so it was all for nothing, or be so toxic and annoying that the killer decides to just give up on the chase.

the devs tried to balance this by making overpowered killers and also making perks for them that make it so that the killer also has pretty much no choice but to be extremely toxic and use what is easily considered underhanded methods. such as face-camping and tunneling a player just to get a kill. or using killers that make it so that its impossible for even the most unfair/toxic/shameless of players have a hard time getting anything done. (you have to pay real life money for these killers)

so either you get with the shameless acts of unsportsmanship that completely ruin any notion of a horror movie/game environment. or fight against the current and either get nowhere or, if youre a really skilled gamer, take a long time grinding your way to the top while enduring sooooo much toxic butthurt-ness from these other players that DEMAND that you play by their made up rules

warning: game is still super addictive
